quest.name: Lone Survivor
journal: When the land is at war, the meanest lodgings never lack for tenants who sleep fitfully and wake screaming.
The deputy postmoogle has a mysterious delivery for you. Perhaps the recipient, the hermit Drest of the Severed String, can shed some light on the puzzling letter.

Drest's reaction is not exactly what one would call enlightening, but it certainly lives up to the postmoogle's fanfare. Signed, “The Ones You Killed,” the letter calls the hermit “Dashing Drest” and asks a singular question: “Do you dream of rain?” Reflect on it while you retrieve Drest's precious leather sack from Raincatcher Gully.

You find the leather sack, though you can still make neither head nor tail of the message in the letter. Perhaps Drest will have something to say about it, when you deliver the sack with its hoard of gil.

Drest's hard-won gil is gone from the sack, replaced with a blood-caked helm of a Garlean legionnaire. The terrified hermit begs you to draw off any watchers outside the shack, then meet him near the House of Sticks in lower La Noscea to guard him on his flight.

You arrive at the appointed location and discover that the rendezvous has become a rescue mission. Save Drest from the Garlean legionnaires and see whether you can finally get to the bottom of this very strange delivery.

Drest is safe, and may yet find his way out of the thorn–wood of his heart. You suspect that what happened on a rainy night three years ago was but the last straw, and the tragedy began when Garlemald set its sights on Drest's homeland... But that story is for another day.
objectives: Deliver the mysterious letter to Drest in eastern La Noscea.
Deliver the leather sack to Drest.
Rendezvous with Drest in lower La Noscea.

dialogue.name: LETTERMOOGLE
dialogue.text: My trusty Forename! I have a delivery for you, addressed to Drest at the Severed String, over in Raincatcher Gully, kupo. But...

dialogue.name: LETTERMOOGLE
dialogue.text: I promised the Seedseers no more secrets, kupo! The letter was handed to me in a most curious way. Why, he seemed not to know of postmoogles, and was very furtive to boot.

dialogue.name: LETTERMOOGLE
dialogue.text: I introduced myself in a way that did credit to our kind, you can be sure! But when he asked me to deliver the letter in his stead, do you know what he said?

dialogue.name: LETTERMOOGLE
dialogue.text: “Don't deliver it now; wait a few days”! Have you heard the like before? I know how much you enjoy the strange and the suspicious, so here you are, kupo!

dialogue.name: LETTERMOOGLE
dialogue.text: This letter is for Drest at the Severed String, over in Raincatcher Gully. A very strange delivery in my opinion, kupo!

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: It's...you. Been a while. A letter...a letter from who? Nobody knows me...

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text:
"My dear Dashing Drest,
Do you dream of rain?

The Ones You Killed“

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: H-How did they know? Ghosts...ghosts that won't leave me in peace...!

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Taunting me. Before they...kill me. No...no...no! I won't let them! I'll run─I'll start over somewhere else!

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Help me! There's a leather sack hidden east of here. A peaceful spot...surrounded by rocks...trees...

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: My savings... Gil...gil to go home with. Home to...my family. Get it for me, help me!

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Get my savings... A leather sack...hidden. A peaceful spot...surrounded by rocks...trees... East of here, help me!

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Did...did you find it? Did you find the leather sack?

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Thank the... But let me look inside─must be sure...

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text:
What...?
No...no...no...

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Just a dream...a dream! Let me wake...wake...wake... Oh gods, mercy, have mercy!

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: You see it too!? No...no dream... A bloody helm...black blood, old blood! Idem in me...by the majesty of Garlemald...never to desert...idem in me!

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Ghosts...ghosts...ghosts. Three years, not a single night of peace and now...they rise.

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Help me, they're watching right now. I...I have to get out of here. Go somewhere else...just a short while. Then I can...I can go home.

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: I'll go...out the back after you go out the front. Meet me...near the abandoned house in lower La Noscea. You know...the kobolds' squat. The House of Sticks.

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Must...must be careful. I'll go...after you leave. The House of Sticks... Meet me near the House of Sticks.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUE
dialogue.text: You'll clean that helm tonight, worm. Lick the blood and brains off of it while we drink the wine bought with your paltry hoard...

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUE
dialogue.text: Once a craven, always a craven. Flushed you out like a rabbit with that letter. Isn't that what desert conies do? Dash!?

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: You...died. You all died.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUE
dialogue.text: Not all, just most. Three good soldiers survived...and you. Figured you for dead until I saw you skulking by the water a week ago.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUE
dialogue.text: Do you think we don't dream of rain, worm? What honor in surviving an ambush, eh? Three years of disdain─that ends when we hand over a deserter to the cudgel–man.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUE
dialogue.text: Hm? You a friend to this scum? You ought to pick them more carefully!

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: The soldiers fix you with a murderous gaze!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Your blood will paint my path to glory!

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: <groan> I should have known...this would happen. Now I'll never go home...

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUE
dialogue.text: Look at it this way, Dashing Drest: this is an easier way to go than what they do to deserters back in Garlemald!

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Thank...thank you. There's no one...knows I'm alive now. I'm...safe.

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: I was in a unit...of Garlean scouts. A Maelstrom ambush in heavy rain, three years ago.

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: I thought...I was the only survivor. It didn't feel like desertion. It felt like...dying.

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: You heard what they called me. Dashing Drest. I never tried to...run before that night. They...kill you for that. It's from...before...in the desert, I...

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Why did you...protect me? We're not kin. Look at me, I'm barely...barely a man. A broken, craven thing...

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: You decided I should live. How...do you do that? I can't even decide some days...which foot to move first.

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Do you think...I can be well again? Decide to live...not just be afraid to die?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It all begins with the first step.

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: True... I haven't thought things through in...in a long time. Not since my homeland fell to the Empire.

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: No...you don't have the answers either. But you─ You know that. And you can still...you can still decide. Without answers.

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Home is─home isn't somewhere I can buy a fare to. It's not a sack of gil or answers I need but questions. Why does it hurt? How do I feel...

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: I will see my children again. But it's not the time yet. I think─I think, though, it will come. That's a start...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With your successful delivery, your reputation as a letter carrier has grown!
